intro: Orophea coriacea, commonly known as the rough orophea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Guttiferae and is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne on short peduncles. Orophea coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of Malagasy flora.
